topic.title: Global Secondary Indexes
topic.shortdesc: A Global Secondary Index (GSI) supports queries that require filtering.

body.p: Global Secondary Indexes provide the following advantages:

ul.li: Predictable Performance: Core, key-based operations maintain predictable low-latency, even in the presence of a large number of indexes. Index-maintenance is non-competitive with key-based operations, even when data-mutation constitutes a heavy workload.

Low Latency Querying: GSIs reside on specific cluster-nodes running the Index Service: therefore, the Query Service, can access them directly, without using hashing routines; and is not obliged to consider how data has been dispersed across nodes running the Date Service.
Advanced Scaling: Able to be assigned independently to alternative or additional cluster-nodes, new GSIs can be added to a cluster without existing workload patterns being affected.

section.title: Creating Global Secondary Indexes
section.p: Both Primary and Secondary indexes can be created by means of the N1QL query-language; using the CREATE INDEX statement, and the USING GSI clause. For more information, see .
